Reshape CI between wide/long formats

Source: R/reshape_ci.R
reshape_ci.Rd

Reshape CI between wide/long formats.

reshape_ci(x)

Arguments

x

A data.frame containing CI_low and CI_high.

Examples

library(bayestestR)

x <- data.frame(replicate(4, rnorm(100)))
x <- ci(x, ci = c(0.68, 0.89, 0.95))
reshape_ci(x)
#>   Parameter  CI_low_68 CI_high_68 CI_low_89 CI_high_89 CI_low_95 CI_high_95
#> 1        X1 -0.9288844  0.9183050 -1.224556   1.369760 -1.616946   1.517234
#> 2        X2 -0.8735949  0.9384387 -1.485577   1.558253 -1.715870   1.859410
#> 3        X3 -1.0887625  1.1907155 -1.686155   1.766932 -2.104696   1.922662
#> 4        X4 -0.7282173  0.9773763 -1.183589   1.317665 -1.715239   1.671268
reshape_ci(reshape_ci(x))
#>    Parameter CI     CI_low   CI_high
#> 1         X1 68 -0.9288844 0.9183050
#> 2         X1 89 -1.2245561 1.3697602
#> 3         X1 95 -1.6169460 1.5172340
#> 4         X2 68 -0.8735949 0.9384387
#> 5         X2 89 -1.4855772 1.5582527
#> 6         X2 95 -1.7158697 1.8594098
#> 7         X3 68 -1.0887625 1.1907155
#> 8         X3 89 -1.6861545 1.7669319
#> 9         X3 95 -2.1046959 1.9226621
#> 10        X4 68 -0.7282173 0.9773763
#> 11        X4 89 -1.1835891 1.3176655
#> 12        X4 95 -1.7152390 1.6712682

x <- data.frame(replicate(4, rnorm(100)))
x <- describe_posterior(x, ci = c(0.68, 0.89, 0.95))
reshape_ci(x)
#>   Parameter     Median  CI_low_68 CI_high_68 CI_low_89 CI_high_89 CI_low_95
#> 1        X1 -0.1910732 -1.1259728  0.6993927 -1.535975   1.384067 -1.678999
#> 2        X2  0.1474839 -0.6872927  1.2671559 -1.336921   1.796918 -2.013256
#> 3        X3 -0.1927495 -0.9860032  0.7626895 -1.526567   1.441928 -1.809352
#> 4        X4 -0.1222675 -0.8384166  1.1562827 -1.415651   1.776586 -2.145562
#>   CI_high_95   pd ROPE_CI ROPE_low ROPE_high ROPE_Percentage
#> 1   1.738932 0.57      89     -0.1       0.1      0.11111111
#> 2   1.796918 0.54      89     -0.1       0.1      0.05555556
#> 3   1.501262 0.61      89     -0.1       0.1      0.07777778
#> 4   2.083564 0.57      89     -0.1       0.1      0.10000000
reshape_ci(reshape_ci(x))
#>    Parameter     Median CI     CI_low   CI_high   pd ROPE_CI ROPE_low ROPE_high
#> 1         X1 -0.1910732 68 -1.1259728 0.6993927 0.57      89     -0.1       0.1
#> 2         X1 -0.1910732 89 -1.5359753 1.3840668 0.57      89     -0.1       0.1
#> 3         X1 -0.1910732 95 -1.6789988 1.7389322 0.57      89     -0.1       0.1
#> 4         X2  0.1474839 68 -0.6872927 1.2671559 0.54      89     -0.1       0.1
#> 5         X2  0.1474839 89 -1.3369211 1.7969184 0.54      89     -0.1       0.1
#> 6         X2  0.1474839 95 -2.0132564 1.7969184 0.54      89     -0.1       0.1
#> 7         X3 -0.1927495 68 -0.9860032 0.7626895 0.61      89     -0.1       0.1
#> 8         X3 -0.1927495 89 -1.5265671 1.4419282 0.61      89     -0.1       0.1
#> 9         X3 -0.1927495 95 -1.8093518 1.5012616 0.61      89     -0.1       0.1
#> 10        X4 -0.1222675 68 -0.8384166 1.1562827 0.57      89     -0.1       0.1
#> 11        X4 -0.1222675 89 -1.4156508 1.7765861 0.57      89     -0.1       0.1
#> 12        X4 -0.1222675 95 -2.1455616 2.0835635 0.57      89     -0.1       0.1
#>    ROPE_Percentage
#> 1       0.11111111
#> 2       0.11111111
#> 3       0.11111111
#> 4       0.05555556
#> 5       0.05555556
#> 6       0.05555556
#> 7       0.07777778
#> 8       0.07777778
#> 9       0.07777778
#> 10      0.10000000
#> 11      0.10000000
#> 12      0.10000000
